gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components
Interface IVirtualArray2D

All Superinterfaces:
IVirtualArray
All Known Subinterfaces:
IMutableVirtualArray2D
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayGenerator, VirtualArray2D
public interface IVirtualArray2D
extends IVirtualArray

This interface is implemented by classes that can produce a "logical" 2-D array of floats and is used to pass data to viewers and view components. Along with the data, some information, such as at title, and axis labels and units, are kept with the virtual array. An IVirtualArray2D has the same logical format as a typical 2D array. Below is an example of an M x N virtual array.

| (0,0) (0,1) (0,2) ... (0,N-1) |
| (1,0) (1,1) (1,2) ... (1,N-1) |
| (2,0) (2,1) (2,2) ... (2,N-1) |
| ... ... ... ... ... |
| (M-1,0) (M-1,1) (M-1,2) ... (M-1,N-1) |
All references to rows and columns are interpretted to mean row number and column number where an M x N array has M rows, and N columns. The row numbers start at zero and go to M-1 and the column numbers start at zero and go to N-1. In the current version of IVirtualArray2D, the values of the array cannot be set. This is to allow the interface to be implemented by classes that calculate or extract a regular array of values from some more complicated underlying data structures. In such cases, it is not meaningiful to set the values, just to get them. IF the values must be set, then the IMutableVirtualArray2D interface should be implemented.

See Also:
IMutableVirtualArray2D, AxisInfo

Method Detail

setAxisInfo

void setAxisInfo(int axis,
                 float min,
                 float max,
                 java.lang.String label,
                 java.lang.String units,
                 int scale)
Sets the attributes of the data array within a AxisInfo wrapper. This method will take in an integer to determine which axis info is being altered.

Parameters:
axis - Use AxisInfo.X_AXIS (0) or AxisInfo.Y_AXIS (1).
min - Minimum value for this axis.
max - Maximum value for this axis.
label - Label associated with the axis.
units - Units associated with the values for this axis.
scale - Is axis LINEAR, TRU_LOG, PSEUDO_LOG?

getRowValues

float[] getRowValues(int row,
                     int from,
                     int to)
Get values for a portion or all of a row. The "from" and "to" values must be direct array reference, i.e. because the array positions start at zero, not one, this must be accounted for. If the array passed in exceeds the bounds of the array, get values for array elements and ignore extra values.

Parameters:
row - the row number being altered
from - the column number of first element to be altered
to - the column number of the last element to be altered
Returns:
If row, from, and to are valid, an array of floats containing the specified section of the row is returned. If row, from, or to are invalid, an empty 1-D array is returned.

getColumnValues

float[] getColumnValues(int column,
                        int from,
                        int to)
Get values for a portion or all of a column. The "from" and "to" values must be direct array reference, i.e. because the array positions start at zero, not one, this must be accounted for. If the array passed in exceeds the bounds of the array, get values for array elements and ignore extra values.

Parameters:
column - column number of desired column
from - the row number of first element to be altered
to - the row number of the last element to be altered
Returns:
If column, from, and to are valid, an array of floats containing the specified section of the row is returned. If row, from, or to are invalid, an empty 1-D array is returned.

getDataValue

float getDataValue(int row,
                   int column)
Get value for a single array element.

Parameters:
row - row number of element
column - column number of element
Returns:
If element is found, the float value for that element is returned. If element is not found, Float.NaN is returned.

getRegionValues

float[][] getRegionValues(int row_start,
                          int row_stop,
                          int col_start,
                          int col_stop)
Returns the values in the specified region. The vertical dimensions of the region are specified by starting at first row and ending at the last row. The horizontal dimensions are determined by the first column and last column.

Parameters:
row_start - first row of the region
row_stop - last row of the region
col_start - first column of the region
col_stop - last column of the region
Returns:
If a portion of the array is specified, a 2-D array copy of this portion will be returned. If all of the array is specified, a reference to the actual array will be returned.

getNumRows

int getNumRows()
Returns number of rows in the array.

Returns:
This returns the number of rows in the array.

getNumColumns

int getNumColumns()
Returns number of columns in the array.

Returns:
This returns the number of columns in the array.

getErrors

float[][] getErrors()
Get the error values corresponding to the data. If no error values have been set, the square-root of the data value will be returned.

Returns:
error values of the data.

getErrorValue

float getErrorValue(int row,
                    int column)
Get an error value for a given row and column. Returns Float.NaN if row or column are invalid.

Parameters:
row - Row number.
column - Column number.
Returns:
error value for data at [row,column]. If row or column is invalid, Float.NaN is returned.
